intro: Cerinthe glabra subsp. glabra, commonly known as the smooth cerinthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and open woodlands. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The subspecies is distinguished by its smooth, glabrous stems compared to other varieties within the species.
